result.execSummary:
The defendant Travaris J Short was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: With credit for 3 days time served. Huber release to be determined by HOC staff and Day Reporting Center. Court does not object to electronic monitoring.

miscConds.notes:
- Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may never possess a firearm.
- Court advised defendant that he/she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

- No possession of controlled substances/alcohol without a valid prescription.
- No possession of firearms/ammunition/magazines/holsters/body armor.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.

- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Travaris J Short

records.addlTxt: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea and Elements/Jury Instructions, filed.

Defendant Travaris J Short in court.  Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court for Travaris J Short.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting 

Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

The Court ordered defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, with credit for 3 days time served. Huber release to be determined by HOC staff and Day Reporting Center. Court does not object to electronic monitoring.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 1 YEAR probation. 

Conditions of Probation:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute sobriety.
- DNA sample.
- No possession of controlled substances/alcohol without a valid prescription.
- No possession of firearms/ammunition/magazines/holsters/body armor. 
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
- Court ordered defendant's driving privileges REVOKED for 6 months.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following within 1 year.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Fine in the amount of $1000.00; 
All mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including DNA); 
Any cash bond on deposit to be applied. 

20 day appeal rights given,
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his/her right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he/she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing. Court in trial. parties requests adjournment.

Defendant Travaris J Short in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests a Plea and Sentencing date. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing in Branch 25.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.

JusticePoint Supervision Report dated June 10, 2022 - received

Defendant Travaris J Short in court with Attorney Darryl Everett Smith; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No driving.

Defendant Travaris J Short in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Travaris J Short in custody.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Travaris J Short appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
